data.title: Cheryl
data.meta_description: Read all about Cheryl with TV Guide's exclusive biography including their list of awards, celeb facts and more at TV Guide.
data.text:
Fast Facts

Grew up on a council estate

Began modeling at age 3

Attended the Royal Ballet's summer school in London at age 9

Her parents couldn't afford the 300 British pound fee, so a local newspaper raised the funds for her

Decided to ditch dancing and become a singer at age 12

Discovered on Popstars: The Rivals, a 2002-03 music-competition TV series in Britain that formed all-girl and all-boy groups

She made the cut and was cast in Girls Aloud, which went on to become a very popular group in England

Helped raise 3

4 million British pounds for the Comic Relief charity by climbing Mount Kilimanjaro in 2009

Founded the Cheryl Cole Foundation in 2011 to support the Prince's Trust and other charities that help disadvantaged young people
